newsitem.title: USA: 3Com Q3 system product sales up 24 pct.
newsitem.headline: 3Com Q3 system product sales up 24 pct.

text.p: 3Com Corp said on Thursday that sales of systems products, including switches, hubs, internetworking and remote access products, rose 24 percent in the third quarter ending February 28 to $432.6 million.
In a statement accompanying 3Com's financial results, the data networking company said sales of network adapters increased 39 percent from the third quarter a year ago, to $346.3 million.

For the quarter ended February 28, 3Com said net income rose to $87.6 million or $0.47 a share from $74.6 million or $0.42 a share in the year-ago period. Sales rose 30 percent to $786.8 million. The results were slightly above the First Call estimate of $0.46 a share.

Chairman and Chief Executive Eric Benhamou said, "During the quarter we saw strong demand for our high-end networking solutions, particularly ATM systems, and the number of multi-million dollar orders we received from large accounts has never been greater."

"At the same time, our industry is in the midst of many important transitions," Benhamou added, citing the adoption of higher-speed technologies, new paradigms for switching and routing network traffic, and more volume-based pricing and distribution.

He said that as a result of these changes, 3Com's results in the latest quarter reflected "increased price competition and a pause in industry demand as enterprise networking customers and network service providers assess how best to maximize their networking investments."
But he added that the changes were "positive for 3Com and the industry in the long run."
Last month, 3Com announced a definitive agreement to merge with U.S. Robotics Corp, forming a combined company with annual revenues in excess of $5 billion.

Under terms of the agreement, each share of U.S. Robotics stock will be exchanged for 1.75 shares of 3Com stock. 3Com reiterated the transaction will be accounted for as a pooling of interests, and is expected to be neutral to slightly accretive to 3Com earnings in fiscal 1998.
